ALPINE.Defintion: relating to the Alps (the mountain range)

BACKGROUND.Defintion: the set of conditions that existed before a particular event, or information about them which helps to explain the event

BIASED.Defintion: preferring or disliking someone or something more than someone or something else, in a way that means that they are treated unfairly

BROADCAST.Defintion: to send out a programme on television or radio

CIRCULATION.Defintion: the number of people that a newspaper or magazine is regularly sold to

CONVINCE.Defintion: to persuade someone or make someone certain

DATE BACK.Defintion: to have existed for a particular length of time or since a particular time

DECLARING.Defintion: to announce something clearly, firmly, publicly, or officially

ERA.Defintion: a period of time of which particular events or stages of development are typical

EXOTIC.Defintion: unusual and exciting because of coming (or seeming to come) from far away, especially a tropical country

FUNCTIONALITY.Defintion: any or all of the operations performed by a piece of equipment or a software program

FUNERAL.Defintion: a (usually religious) ceremony for burying or burning the body of a dead person

GRAVITY.Defintion: the force that attracts objects towards one another, especially the force that makes things fall to the ground

HARVESTED.Defintion: the crops that have been gathered

HIGHBROW.Defintion: (of books, plays, etc.) involving serious and complicated or artistic ideas, or (of people) interested in serious and complicated subjects

INCREASINGLY.Defintion: to (make something) become larger in amount or size

INTRAVENOUS.Defintion: into or connected to a vein

KEEN.Defintion: very interested, eager, or wanting (to do) something very much

LOWBROW.Defintion: (of entertainment) not complicated or demanding much intelligence to be understood

MASS MEDIA.Defintion: newspapers, television, radio, and the internet

MINION.Defintion: a main character from the Despicable Me series

ORIGINS.Defintion: the beginning or cause of something

PINT.Defintion: a measure for liquid equal to about half a litre, used as a typical measure for beer

POP CULTURE.Defintion: music, TV, cinema, books, etc. that are popular and enjoyed by ordinary people, rather than experts or very educated people

PRACTICAL JOKES.Defintion: a joke that makes someone seem silly and involves a physical action rather than words

PRANK.Defintion: a trick that is intended to be funny but not to cause harm or damage

PRESCRIPTION.Defintion: a piece of paper on which a doctor writes the details of the medicine or drugs that someone needs

PROVED.Defintion: to show a particular result after a period of time

REFLECT.Defintion: to show, express, or be a sign of something

RIDICULOUS.Defintion: stupid or unreasonable and deserving to be laughed at

SHAME.Defintion: If something is described as a shame, it is disappointing or not satisfactory

SO-CALLED.Defintion: used to show that you think a word that is used to describe someone or something is not suitable or not correct

SPOILS.Defintion: destroys or reduces the pleasure, interest, or beauty of something

TRICKING.Defintion: an action that is intended to deceive, either as a way of cheating someone, or as a joke or form of entertainment

TUBE.Defintion: a long, hollow cylinder of plastic, metal, rubber, or glass, used for moving or containing liquids or gases

UNIQUE.Defintion: being the only existing one of its type or, more generally, unusual, or special in some way
